reference.title: Authentication Source category
reference.shortdesc: The authentication source category of operations is used to set a list of allowed redirect URIs for broker-based authentication sources.

section.title: Supported operations
section.p: The authentication source category is supported in the following operations:

row.entry: Update redirect URIs for authentication source

section.title: Mutation syntax
section.codeblock: authSourceJWTUpdate(authSourceJWT: AuthSourceJWTUpdateInput!): AuthSourceJWT! authSourceDelete(id: ID!): ID!

section.title: Response fields

row.entry: The name of the authentication source.
A list of strings that filter incoming authorization requests based on the requests declared in the redirectUri query-parameter.
A broker-based authentication source that delegates to a third-party identity provider using OpenID Connect.
A broker-based authentication source that delegates to a third-party identity provider using SAML.
A broker-based authentication source that provides basic auth-like functionality.
An authentication source that delegates to a third-party identity provider that uses OpenID Connect. This type relies on access tokens that adhere to the JSON Web Token (JWT) specification.
A gateway-hosted authentication source that provides basic authentication functionality.

section.title: GraphQL implementation
section.p: To query the currently allowed redirect URIs or to set the allowed redirect URIs, send a request with a mutation and GUID for the authentication source.
